name: consumer electronics production, mobile device, tablet | consumer electronics, mobile device, tablet | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/24691/documentation

This activity represents the production of one unit of a tablet (approx. 10-inch). It is based on an LCA of a smartphone[1] and scaled to fit the composition and proportions of a tablet. The scaling was done with a average composition of tablets([3], [4], [5], [6], [7], [8], [9])  The battery, display, mainboard, earpiece + speaker, internal cables and connector are included through separate datasets. An external charging device as well as a data cable [2]. Tap water and electricity data was taken from [4].;Sources:;- [1] Güvendik, M. (2014) From Smartphone to Futurephone: Assessing the environmental impacts of different circular economy scenarios of a smartphone using LCA.;- [2] Monier, V. et al. (2007) Preparatory Studies for Eco-design Requirements of EuPs, Battery chargers and external power supplies, Final report.;- [3] Hischier, R. et al. (2015) ‘Grey Energy and Environmental Impacts of ICT Hardware’, in ICT Innovations for Sustainability. Springer, pp. 171–189. doi: 10.1007/978-3-319-09228-7.;- [4] Hischier, R., Achachlouei, M. A. and Hilty, L. M. (2014) ‘Evaluating the sustainability of electronic media: Strategies for life cycle inventory data collection and their implications for LCA results’, Environmental Modelling and Software, 56(Lci), pp. 27–36. doi: 10.1016/j.envsoft.2014.01.001.;- [5] Apple Inc. (2019) iPad Environmental report. Available at: http://www.apple.com/environment/reports/.;- [6] Apple Inc. (2017) 12.9-inch iPad Pro Environmental Report. Available at: http://www.apple.com/environment/reports/.;- [7] Apple Inc. (2014) 9.7-inch iPad Pro Environmental Report. Available at: http://www.apple.com/environment/reports/.;- [8] Apple Inc. (2017) iPad Environmental Report. Available at: http://www.apple.com/environment/reports/.;- [9] Apple Inc. (2017) 10.5-inch iPad Pro Environmental Report. Available at: http://www.apple.com/environment/reports/.

From reception of materials and auxiliares at the factory gate. 

The activity includes the materials, processes and energy use for the production of a tablet computer. The dataset includes the exchange "used tablet" to take into account the disposal. Data on factory and packaging are not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/26:Manufacture of computer, electronic and optical products/264:Manufacture of consumer electronics/2640:Manufacture of consumer electronics

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average electronic device.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data for composition are from 2011-2019 but represent current technology.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data is based on an LCA study of a smartphone [1]. The components were scaled to fit the composition of a tablet ([3], [4], [5], [6], [7], [8], [9]). The scaled parts are: battery, display, aluminium, Glass, printed wiring boards, steel, plastics and other, which includes all components not represented by the other parts in [1].

exchanges.description:
Literature Value. Represents the charing cable without plugs. Copper wire (0.0075kg) + Isolation (0.00186kg) + Nylon (0.0006kg) divided by dry mass of "cable, connector for computer, without plugs" (0.065kg/unit).
Source: V. Monier, S. Mudgal, L. Turunen, K. Schischke, C. Ciaglia, and N. F. Nissen, “Preparatory Studies for Eco-design Requirements of EuPs, Battery chargers and external power supplies, Final report,” 2007.
